header.title: 'Harmless innuendo' Alex Salmond defends joke about Sturgeon after SNP leader's backlash
header.subtitle: ALEX Salmond has defended a controversial joke he made about having sex with female MPs, including Nicola Sturgeon and Theresa May, by claiming it was “harmless innuendo”.
header.postText: 'Speaking on STV’s Edinburgh Festival Late Show last night he said: It was taken totally out of context. It was a piece of harmless innuendo, nothing more than that.', 'The former Scottish first minister was criticised for making the crude joke on the first night of a show he’s performing during the Edinburgh Festival.', 'He told the audience: I promised you today we’d either have Theresa May or Nicola Sturgeon or Ruth Davidson or Melania Trump but I couldn’t make any of these wonderful women come...', 'That was followed by a drumroll before he added: ...to the show.', 'His successor Ms Sturgeon was not impressed, saying in response earlier this week that Mr Salmond is not always as funny as he thinks he is.', 'She added: Perhaps this is an example of a joke that perhaps belongs more in the Benny Hill era than it does in the modern era.', 'During yesterday’s show, Mr Salmond admitted he was a fan of the comedian, who had his heyday in the Seventies.', 'He said: Actually, Benny Hill was quite talented.I mean, he made a living for years on television so he didnae do too badly.', The politician's show 'Unleashed' has been advertised as a bit of light - hearted banter with a few behind the scenes revelations about his time in power,', 'Each show involves the appearance of a special guest, which prompted Mr Salmond to make his crude quip about the female politicians on Saturday.', 'While he has defended the joke as “harmless”, others have said it is damaging and sexist.', 'GETTY', 'Labour MSP Monica Lennon called the comment a “horrendous example to young men”.', 'The Scottish Labour equalities spokesman, said: “It would be wrong to laugh these comments off as a bit of banter –this is a former First Minister degrading female politicians.', '“Alex Salmond should know comments like these are simply unacceptable and he should apologise.', '“It would set a horrendous example to young men if he tries to hide behind these sexist comments as risqué humour.”', 'And Talat Yaqoob, co-founder of the cross-party Women 50:50 group, said: “I don’t think it is an appropriate joke to be making.', '“Aside from it not being particularly funny, it illustrates the sexism women experience despite being at a high level of leadership.', '“Any such sexualisation by a former First Minister is particularly disappointing as he should be more aware of the impact of his words.'
header.socioLingVar: Physical Identity - Physical Features,Age - Youngsters,Gender - General,Age - Over 65s

commentThread.commentText: I hope, for his sake,  he is not planning a permanent career in comedy......... With a sense of humour like that, he could starve to death in a week....

replies.commentText: You're joking. He could live off that barrel of lard for years.
With what he must have stashed in his chubby cheeks, he would last a wee bit longer than that. With what he must have stashed away in his bank accounts, he could last for many years!

commentThread.commentText: This suggest that Fatman's comedy career will be somewhat shorter than his tenure in politics, obscurity beckons, bye bye Fatman!!

Nice to see his protege Nippy who he nurtured for years put the pin in at the first opportunity. Given the way she has attempted to screw Britain whenever she is has the chance, it's hardly surprising.
He's always been a creep, from the same creepy mould as George Galloway

replies.commentText: Anna Sozzlebry, that kills me that does.

commentThread.commentText: It's Sex Ed. today but if I keep working very hard I'll certainly soon come over.

Thing is Mr Salmond... you're a part of the establishment. The establishment make the rules on what is, and what isn't morally or socially acceptable. If someone like me did that in the workplace I would lose my job, pension the lot. It's not the harmless joke which offends me, it's the fact that you think you can behave in a way that is objectionable and not face the same consequences as the rest of us.

replies.commentText: Yeah, I bet you do. I bet you perspire profusely and screw your eyes up while you're thinking about it.
Go and lie down and put a wet flannel on your forehead will you. I bet you're a real barrel of laughs....dinner party company.
Barrel of lard more like.
Don't I wonder what's all over his wet flannel.
Meant of zibbe
Don't confuse innuendo with getting your comeuppance.

commentThread.commentText: Innuendo?... I thought that was an Italian suppository. Fat Eck meanwhile is as witty and as funny as terminal cancer. He should stick to his gambling habits.. that's what he loves most..

Thus proving once again he is a total fool. There is no such thing as harmless innuendo.There hasn't been for around ten years. The rabid professional offence industry must be fed. The more ludicrous and petty the offence, the better. Apology for nothing is all the rage, and the ability to be offended on behalf of anyone, for anything is power.It ensures continued funding and free stuff.
I doubt Fatty Arbuckle would be able to come.............................back on the Edinburgh Fringe.

If a scottish comedian, say Frankie Boyle, said this it is funny but if a scottish politician says it, it is sexist??? Female politicians in scotland are the rudest in the world when talking about their opponents but also the first to use the female card. And we all know nicola, that alex helped you hugely to get to the top. You would not be keader but for tge assistance help and advice from alex.
Poor old Salmond can't admit he's wrong. Maybe he's just a little bit frustrated? His wife is terribly old. Must be like sticking your donger in a bag af Walkers salt and vinegar.

replies.commentText: Making it crisp helps when you're older.
(null)
Macron in 15 years time!

commentThread.commentText: I agree Alex it was fun, but P.C. wise you are out boy no more politics for Alex.
Now we know. The SNP is a comedy standup act but not very funny.
"His time in power"....yeah, at Scotland Cunty Council. This bloated gargoyle is a waste of oxygen.

replies.commentText: And that wasn't a misspelling of "County"......

commentThread.commentText: It would be hard to believe that he could actually get women to come........  to the show!
Lucy Waterlow. An innuendo in itself.
Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear.................
More feminist complaining about nothing more than PC nonsense.

I agree for once with Alex Salmond. Innuendo is my history, the history of my peers, the history of my society, the history of my culture. I use it all the time and it makes people around me laugh and joke back. Who cares if some people, particularly the boring left-wing, are too serious for their own good. Just arise above it all & enjoy one-up-man-ship.

replies.commentText: But this man has spent his life telling us that sexism and all that is wrong. Now he's desperate for a few quid it's ok? No wonder people ridicule him, he'll never get his seat back, I doubt even the SNP will want him.

Don.t be ridiculous. If you understand inuendo then you know the meaning and if you know the meaning you can't be offended because that is already inside your head. If you care to put a perverted slant to a sentence just because there was a break in it then you are the sad one. An innocent would just assume he had lost track temporararily of what he was saying. He couldn't get Nicola to come to the show?? Whats wrong with that. However, the man is still a first rate prat.
Once you lose your seat you leave an empty feeling behind.
Aye it goes wi his empty heid

commentThread.commentText: I think you are all being very unfair. I much prefer his humour than his politics. That said, am I allowed to admit that Benny Hill was hilarious and that most of the world has had a humour bypass in recent years.

replies.commentText: His humour? Nothing funny about this man.
Kind of you to give Genieman a hand.
Zibbe should be called sobby!
Heh, I was before you...lol

commentThread.commentText: No good as a politician, no good as a comedian i guess he must be good at SOMETHING.  I know maybe he would be good if he was just very quite.
